text: $$/lim(x$$ , 1**+, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$ from the right side. Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$1$$ on the graph and observe the value of f(x) from the right.\n##figure2.gif##

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching when $$x$$ approaches $$1$$ from the right side? If the limit is $$\infty$$, write $$-\infty$$ or $$+\infty$$. If the limit does not exist, write 'DNE'.

title: Limit Value
text: $$/lim(x$$ , 1**+, f(x)) $$=$$ $$2$$. Looking at the right side of the function as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$, we can see that the value of f(x) approaches $$2$$. Remember that there is no difference with an open or closed circle because a limit is the value the graph is approaching from the right and left sides. In this case, we are looking solely at the right side of the function.\n##figure3.gif##
